subject: Tennis
Suspensions, Dismissals and Resignations
lead_paragraph: The ATP suspended the Italians Potito Starace and Daniele Bracciali Saturday for making bets — some as little as $7 — on tennis matches involving other players.The Italian federation denounced the penalties by the governing body as an injustice, and the players said they have been made scapegoats.Starace, ranked 31st, was suspended for six weeks and fined $30,000, the federation said. Bracciali, ranked 258th, was banned for three months and fined $20,000. Both suspensions take effect Jan. 1.The federation said Starace made five bets for a total of $130 two years ago, and Bracciali made about 50 bets of $7 each from 2004 through 2005.
snippet: The ATP suspended the Italians Potito Starace and Daniele Bracciali Saturday for making bets — some as little as $7 — on tennis matches involving other players.The Italian federation denounced the penalties by the governing body as an injustice,...
